snippet.desc:
This behavior will cause the actor that it is attached on to never leave the screen, then when the camera moves it will not be left behind. Very useful for things like HUDs, Inventory, or anything that must be on the screen.
FUNCTIONS: Fixed on screen: Always on the screen, and in a fixed point. Move Free: Always in the screen, but can move freely. - Bounce: Bounce on the sides of the screen - Teleport: Teleported back when tries to leave the screen - Cant Exit: The object cant pass the sides of the screen, like if they were glass walls and when the camera moves its pushed by the screen
=VERY CUSTOMISABLE=
snippet.description:
This behavior will cause the actor that it is attached on to never leave the screen, then when the camera moves it will not be left behind. Very useful for things like HUDs, Inventory, or anything that must be on the screen.
FUNCTIONS: Fixed on screen: Always on the screen, and in a fixed point. Move Free: Always in the screen, but can move freely. - Bounce: Bounce on the sides of the screen - Teleport: Teleported back when tries to leave the screen - Cant Exit: The object cant pass the sides of the screen, like if they were glass walls and when the camera moves its pushed by the screen
=VERY CUSTOMISABLE=
snippet.name: Always on Screen

number.desc:
- Determines the position "X" of the object on screen.
- If you put "0", the object will be always on the left side of the screen. - And the greater the number, nearest to the right side it will be. - If position X=0 and Y=0 it will be on the upper left corner.
number.name: _PositionXonScreen

number.desc:
- Determines the position "Y" of the object on screen.
- If you put "0", the object will be always on the top of the screen. - And the greater the number, nearest to the bottom of the screen it will be. - If position X=0 and Y=0 it will be on the upper left corner.
number.name: _PositionYonScreen

boolean.desc:
- If Yes, the object will be always in the same point of the screen, so it wont move, useful for HUDs, menus and others.
- If No, Select the other option.
boolean.fullname: Should the object be fixed on a point of the screen?
boolean.name: _Fixedonscreen

boolean.desc:
- If Yes, it will be always on the screen but its free to move.
- If No, select the other option.
boolean.fullname: Or should it move free on the screen?
boolean.name: _Movefree

number.desc:
1 ---> Bounce in the sides of screen. 2 ---> Teleported Back to the screen. 3 ---> Cant pass the sides of the screen and when the camera moves its pushed with it.
*Other values than 1, 2 or 3 wont make anything.
number.fullname: If it move free, Put a number between 1-3
number.name: _IfitmovefreePutanumberbetween13

number.desc: - The force in which the object will be sended back. *If you choosed number 1.
number.name: _Forceofbounce

boolean.desc: *If you choosed number 2.
boolean.fullname: Teleport to the center of the screen?
boolean.name: _TeleportCenter

number.desc: - Put the X position to where the object will be teleported. *If you choosed number 2.
number.fullname: If not to the center, to what X position?
number.name: _XTeleport

number.desc: - Put the Y position to where the object will be teleported. *If you choosed number 2.
number.fullname: If not to the center, to what Y position?
number.name: _YTeleport

boolean.desc: - If the object hit the sides it will be slowed down completely (0 speed) *If you choosed number 2 or 3.
boolean.fullname: When the object hit the sides of screen, slow down its speed to 0?
boolean.name: _SlowDown0

number.desc: *If you choosed number 3.
number.fullname: When the object hit the screen it will be placed how much pixels back?
number.name: _PixelsBack

snippet.desc:
This behavior will keep track of the actor's energy, that can be used to perform certain actions, mainly use skills.

Commands:
- UseEnergy: Will reduce a certain ammount of energy.
- RecoverEnergy: Will recover a certain ammount of the actor's energy.
- FullHeal: Fully recover the actor's energy.
snippet.description:
This behavior will keep track of the actor's energy, that can be used to perform certain actions, mainly use skills.

Commands:
- UseEnergy: Will reduce a certain ammount of energy.
- RecoverEnergy: Will recover a certain ammount of the actor's energy.
- FullHeal: Fully recover the actor's energy.
snippet.name: Energy

boolean.desc: If true, will create an actor that will act as an energy gauge.
boolean.name: _DisplayGauge

actortype.desc: Actor type that will be used as the energy gauge.
actortype.name: _EnergyGaugeType

boolean.desc: If checked, will create an actor that will display the recovered energy. Has extra logic if the display actor has the Display Float Message behavior.
boolean.name: _Displayrecoveredenergy

number.desc: Y Offset of the energy recover display based on the Display Type actor's position.
number.name: _MessageYOffset

number.desc: Time required for the display to slide from the current energy to the new amount after spending or recovering energy.
number.name: _EnergyDisplaySlideTime

number.desc:
The Energy Gauge actor must have one animation, with a number of frames from 0 to [Number of Frames]. Frame 0 will be when the gauge is empty, Frame [Number of Frames] will be when the gauge is full.

Number of Frames should be the last frame of the Energy Gauge's animation.
number.name: _NumberofFrames

list.desc:
The damage modifier. This works with per cent values. Shares the index of the Damage Type Weakness list, so index 0 correspond to the damage modifier of the damage type in index 0 of the Damage Type Weakness list, for example.

Sample values:
200: It will inflict 200% of the total damage
50: It will inflict 50% of the total damage.
-100: It will inflict -100% damage. If the proper attributes are set in the Health behavior, it can either deal no damage, or heal the actor.
list.name: _WeaknessDamageModifier

list.desc: The damage types that have the damage modified for this actor.
list.name: _DamageTypeWeakness

snippet.desc:
Store items for the actor, in the form of two synchronized lists: Inventory (item name) and Amount List (amount of each item).

Comes with the following custom blocks:
- Add Item: add an amount of an item to the actor's inventory.
- Remove Item: remove an amount of an item from the actor's inventory.
- Get Ammount: get the ammount of a specific item from the actor's inventory.
- Remove all: completely remove an item from the inventory (erasing it from both lists).
- as list: converts a value into a list.
- Item is at maximum amount: returns a boolean if the item is at the maximum amount.
- Index of item: returns the index of an item in a list.
- Get item at index: returns the item name in the given index.
- Inventory is full: returns true if the inventory is full.
snippet.description:
Store items for the actor, in the form of two synchronized lists: Inventory (item name) and Amount List (amount of each item).

Comes with the following custom blocks:
- Add Item: add an amount of an item to the actor's inventory.
- Remove Item: remove an amount of an item from the actor's inventory.
- Get Ammount: get the ammount of a specific item from the actor's inventory.
- Remove all: completely remove an item from the inventory (erasing it from both lists).
- as list: converts a value into a list.
- Item is at maximum amount: returns a boolean if the item is at the maximum amount.
- Index of item: returns the index of an item in a list.
- Get item at index: returns the item name in the given index.
- Inventory is full: returns true if the inventory is full.
snippet.name: Inventory

list.desc: List of items to set a specific maximum amount. This independs if the "Limit Amount of Items?" attribute is checked or not, and this list also has priority over the "Maximum Amount" attribute.
list.name: _ItemName

list.desc: Items type. Add items to this list to set the initial items this actor will hold.
list.name: _Inventory

list.desc: Amount of items. Add numbers to this list to set the initial amount of each item type this actor will hold. Shares the index with the Inventory list.
list.name: _AmountList

boolean.desc: If checked, will limit the maximum amount of an item the actor can carry.
boolean.name: _LimitAmountofItems

number.desc: Maximum amount of items.
number.name: _MaximumAmount

list.desc: This list holds specific maximum amounts for different items. This independs if the "Limit Amount of Items?" attribute is checked or not, and this list also has priority over the "Maximum Amount" attribute.
list.name: _MaximumAmountList

boolean.desc: If checked, the actor will only be able to carry a certain number of item types.
boolean.name: _LimitInventorySlots

number.desc: Maximum amount of slots for item types in the inventory.
number.name: _MaximumSlots

snippet.desc: Handle actor status progression based on level. Requires the behavior Experience. Has custom blocks for adding permanent bonus, temporary bonus and timer for temporary bonus.
snippet.description: Handle actor status progression based on level. Requires the behavior Experience. Has custom blocks for adding permanent bonus, temporary bonus and timer for temporary bonus.
snippet.name: Character Status

list.desc:
Used for damage.

Index 0 isn't used, because the minimum level is 1. The index represent the current level.

Example:
Current Level = 1; Strength will be index 1 of the list.
list.name: _StrengthProgression

list.desc:
Used for defense.

Index 0 isn't used, because the minimum level is 1. The index represent the current level.

Example:
Current Level = 1; Vitality will be index 1 of the list.
list.name: _VitalityProgression

list.desc:
Used for magic damage.

Index 0 isn't used, because the minimum level is 1. The index represent the current level.

Example:
Current Level = 1; Inteligence will be index 1 of the list.
list.name: _InteligenceProgression

list.desc:
Used for magic defense.

Index 0 isn't used, because the minimum level is 1. The index represent the current level.

Example:
Current Level = 1; Wisdom will be index 1 of the list.
list.name: _WisdomProgression

list.desc:
Used for critical hits.

Index 0 isn't used, because the minimum level is 1. The index represent the current level.

Example:
Current Level = 1; Luck will be index 1 of the list.
list.name: _LuckProgression

list.desc:
Used to set the maximum health.

Index 0 isn't used, because the minimum level is 1. The index represent the current level.

Example:
Current Level = 1; Health will be index 1 of the list.
list.name: _HealthProgression

list.desc:
Used to set the maximum energy.

Index 0 isn't used, because the minimum level is 1. The index represent the current level.

Example:
Current Level = 1; Energy will be index 1 of the list.
list.name: _EnergyProgression

number.desc: The maximum value the Energy attribute can reach, including temporary modifiers.
number.name: _MaximumEnergy

number.desc: The maximum value the Health attribute can reach, including temporary modifiers.
number.name: _MaximumHealth

number.desc: The maximum value an attribute can reach, including temporary modifiers.
number.name: _MaximumValue

snippet.desc:
Handles experience and character level.

Commands: (tell this behavior this message)
-LevelUp: automatically level up the actor.
snippet.description:
Handles experience and character level.

Commands: (tell this behavior this message)
-LevelUp: automatically level up the actor.
snippet.name: Experience

list.desc:
The first item in the list must be 0. This list will define the required experience for each level.

Think of the list index as the current level, and the value of that index is the required experience to leave that level. For example, index 1 is 10, you need 10 experience points to leave level 1 and reach level 2.
list.name: _RequiredEXP

actortype.desc: Actor type that will be used as the experience gauge.
actortype.name: _EXPGaugeType

boolean.desc: If true, will create an actor that will act as the Experience Gauge.
boolean.name: _DisplayEXP

number.desc: Gauge X Posiiton on screen.
number.name: _XPosition

number.desc: Gauge Y Posiiton on screen.
number.name: _YPosition

actortype.desc: The actor that will display a message at level up.
actortype.name: _LevelUpDisplay

sound.desc: Sound to play when the actor level up.
sound.name: _LevelUpSound

boolean.desc: If checked, the actor will be healed at level up.
boolean.name: _HealWhenLevelUp

text.desc: To be used with the Level Up display actor, if it has the behavior Display Float Message.
text.name: _LevelUpmessage

boolean.desc: If checked, will create an actor that will act as a level up display. Has extra logic if the actor has the Display Float Message behavior.
boolean.name: _Createlevelupdisplay

boolean.desc: If checked, will display the received experience.
boolean.name: _DisplayReceivedExperience

number.desc: Y Offset of the level up message based on the Level Up Display actor's position.
number.name: _LevelUpMessageYOffset

boolean.desc: If checked, the actor will be able to level up. This is usefull if you want to make enemies that use level progression, but can't level up by gaining experience.
boolean.name: _CanLevelUp

number.desc: Y Offset of the received experience message based on the Received EXP DIsplay actor's position.
number.name: _ReceivedEXPMessageYOffset

number.desc:
The Experience Gauge actor must have one animation, with a number of frames from 0 to [Number of Frames]. Frame 0 will be when the gauge is empty, Frame [Number of Frames] will be when the gauge is full.

Number of Frames should be the last frame of the Experience Gauge's animation.
number.name: _NumberofFrames

number.desc: Time required for the display to slide from the current experience to the new amount after gaining experience.
number.name: _ExperienceDisplaySlideTime

snippet.desc:
Set the currently equipped weapon. You can configure various parameters for any amount of weapons you want. You can also set it to create a "weapon" actor, to follow this actor at a set offset.

For the defense parameters to work, you have to attach the Combat Statistics behavior. The inflict status parameter requires the behavior Attack Behavrios Lists.
snippet.description:
Set the currently equipped weapon. You can configure various parameters for any amount of weapons you want. You can also set it to create a "weapon" actor, to follow this actor at a set offset.

For the defense parameters to work, you have to attach the Combat Statistics behavior. The inflict status parameter requires the behavior Attack Behavrios Lists.
snippet.name: Equip Weapon

text.desc: The currently equipped weapon.
text.name: _EquippedWeapon

list.desc: List of all the weapons the actor can use. Must match the actor type if you want to create a weapon actor.
list.name: _WeaponName

boolean.desc:
If checked, will create an actor as the weapon, and make it follow the actor.

The weapon actor must have one animation for every animation of this actor.
boolean.name: _CreateWeapon

list.desc: List of the X offset for the weapons. Will match the index of the Weapon Name list. Only used if Create Weapon? is checked.
list.name: _WeaponXOffset

list.desc: List of the Y offset for the weapons. Will match the index of the Weapon Name list. Only used if Create Weapon? is checked.
list.name: _WeaponYOffset

list.desc:
Set the weapon properties. Fill with the weapon name, followed by a parameter:
Acceptable Parameters:

MinDamage: Minimum damage.
MaxDamage: Maximum damage.
WeaponType: Type of the weapon.
DamageType: Type of the damage inflicted.
Status: Add a status condition to the attack. Only works if this actor has the behavior Attack Behaviors Lists.
[Attribute]Attribute name: increase/decrease an attribute. The Character Status behavior must support the attribute you want to modify. By default, the attributes are Strength, Vitality, Inteligence, Wisdom, Luck, Health and Energy.
[Damage Type]Type name: increase/decrease a damage type modifier. Requires the behavior Damage Type Modifier.
[Status Resistance]Status condition behavior name: increase/decrease resistance to a status condition.
Critical Rate: increase/decrease the critical rate bonus.

Template:
Weapon:Parameter=Number/Text
Weapon:[Attribute]Attribute Name+Number
Weapon:[Attribute]Attribute Name-Number
Weapon:[Damage Type]Type Name+Number
Weapon:[Damage Type]Type Name-Number
Weapon:[Status Resistance]Behavior name+Number
Weapon:[Status Resistance]Behavior name-Number
Weapon:Critical Rate+Number
Weapon:Critical Rate-Number

Example:
Knife:MinDamage=3
Sword:MaxDamage=30
Laser Rifle:WeaponType=Rifle
Bazooka:DamageType=Explosion
Poison Blade:Status=Poison
Force Blade:[Attribute]Strength+140
Blaze Axe:[Damage Type]Fire-20
Purify Whip:[Status Resistance]Status Condition Poison+10 Sharp Edge:Critical Rate+35
list.name: _WeaponProperties

number.desc:
The index of the attribute modifier, for weapons that have this parameter.

Modifications for attributes that uses the same index are overwritten, that's why you need different indexes if you want to stack different modifiers for the attributes.
number.name: _AttributeModifierIndex

snippet.desc:
Handles "poison" status condition. The actor will receive a fraction of its current health in damage, without knockback or stun.

Commands:
- Poison: Inflicts poison.
- StopPoison: Stops poison.

Whenever a behavior allows you to add a status condition, you will use the commands for inflicting the status.

snippet.desc:
This behavior will keep track of the health of the actor, as well as handling damaged received and damage type weakness.

Commands:
- InflictDamage: Inflict damage versus the defense or magic defense of the actor.
- Heal: Recover the actor's health.
- InstantKill: Set the actor's health to 0.
- FullHeal: Fully heal the actor.
snippet.description:
This behavior will keep track of the health of the actor, as well as handling damaged received and damage type weakness.

Commands:
- InflictDamage: Inflict damage versus the defense or magic defense of the actor.
- Heal: Recover the actor's health.
- InstantKill: Set the actor's health to 0.
- FullHeal: Fully heal the actor.

Number of Frames should be the last frame of the Health Gauge's animation.

snippet.desc:
This behavior will automaticaly save a list of actor attributes when the scene is in transition, and load these attributes when the actor is created.

If the actor has the behavior Health, the attributes will only be saved if the Current Health is greater than 0.

For the damage parameters to work, you have to attach the Combat Statistics behavior.
snippet.description:
Set the currently equipped armor. You can configure various parameters for any amount of armors you want. You can also set it to create an "armor" actor, to follow this actor at a set offset.

For the damage parameters to work, you have to attach the Combat Statistics behavior.
snippet.name: Equip Armor

list.desc: List of all the armors the actor can use. Must match the actor type if you want to create a armor actor.

list.name: _ArmorYOffset

list.desc:
Set the armor properties. Fill with the armor name, followed by a parameter:
Acceptable Parameters:

Armor: defense against physical attacks.
MagicArmor: defense against magical attacks.
[Attribute]Attribute name: increase/decrease an attribute. The Character Status behavior must support the attribute you want to modify. By default, the attributes are Strength, Vitality, Inteligence, Wisdom, Luck, Health and Energy.
[Damage Type]Type name: increase/decrease a damage type modifier. Requires the behavior Damage Type Modifier.
[Status Resistance]Status condition behavior name: increase/decrease resistance to a status condition.

Template:
Armor:Parameter=Number/Text
Armor:[Attribute]Attribute Name+Number
Armor:[Attribute]Attribute Name-Number
Armor:[Damage Type]Type Name+Number
Armor:[Damage Type]Type Name-Number
Armor:[Status Resistance]Behavior name+Number
Armor:[Status Resistance]Behavior name-Number

Example:
Leather Armor:Armor=3
Elven Plate:MagicArmor=30
Magic Robe:[Attribute]Inteligence+5
Cold Vest:[Damage Type]Ice-50
Hazard Suit:[Status Resistance]Status Condition Paralyze+30
list.name: _ArmorProperties

number.desc:
The index of the attribute modifier, for weapons that have this parameter.

Modifications for attributes that uses the same index are overwritten, that's why you need different indexes if you want to stack different modifiers for the attributes.

snippet.desc: The Health Manager will track the Actor's current health, as well as provide blocks for healing and damaging the Actor. It can also send messages to other behaviors to allow for a wide range of functionality.

snippet.desc:
Add this behavior to an Actor (usually a Player) to record checkpoints. Each scene should have checkpoint regions created and named using the following scheme:

CP_#_X_Y

Where # is the checkpoint number, and X and Y are numeric values indicating the position that the Actor should be spawned in when respawning at the checkpoint.
snippet.description:
Add this behavior to an Actor (usually a Player) to record checkpoints. Each scene should have checkpoint regions created and named using the following scheme:

CP_#_X_Y

Where # is the checkpoint number, and X and Y are numeric values indicating the position that the Actor should be spawned in when respawning at the checkpoint.
snippet.name: Checkpoint System
